content.description: There was a tree blocking this problem until recently. This has nice rock, cool features, and an airy finish. It is probably a relic based on location, and the tree looked maybe 30 years old? Maybe it was climbable in '80s?Sit start in the right-trending seam to the left side of the large, pentagon shape in the rock. Up and right to a series of good face holds on a small headwall directly over the rotting stump.
content.location: Walk around the right side Monkey Trick Boulder for about 100’ or less. It’s just behind it.

content.description: This is an early escape to Monkey Trick. Right before the business on MT, there is an early escape. You’ll know you’re there when you’re at the knob.
content.location: It is the same as MT.

content.description: This thing is long but not tall. Look for the obvious rising undercut arete. Sit start the far right side and surf left with increasingly difficulty. The crux starts about 2/3 of the way in when the foot bar falls away and the hand holds get really bad. Hang on and go. The best hold is the final hold.The movement and rock-quality are really good. If it were taller, I would give this four stars. Also, I originally tried to exit this at the obvious weakness, but this wouldn’t go for me (it probably goes for someone else though).
content.protection: A pad for the crux. I started off the bare ground.
content.location: This is pretty obvious from the trail. It might be easier to see if you walk past and look back

content.description: This is a little outcrop with a few walls.
